name: Junior Wolff
text:
Purchase a true TaoTao 125 ATV as well as a Kayo 150. They exceeded what the previous dealer in TX sent me..

We went trail riding yesterday and these youth sized atv’s went everywhere that the adult 1000 cc plus atv’s went. Even 3’ of water.

Impressive.

Don’t buy a Chinese bike over the internet that you cannot see, touch or test or you may be like me. Bait and switch and now fighting with the online dealer to take them back.

2 Wheel Heaven had exactly what I needed and now the boys are happy .

That is what counts.

If I could add a pic or video I would to show just how much mud we had on them.

name: tim parker
text: Good service, but wanna price like a dealership. $75 to patch a rear tire. Ouch!

resp.text: We don't patch tires. And we've been in business for 20 years. And our technicians have more experience than any dealership within 100 miles. We aren't the cheapest but we are the best.

name: Laron Langford
text: I paid 580 and he did nothing suppose to take somewhere else you should know a axle bent before barron have the receipt he didnt have a problem collecting money use another atv repair it was a bad job they did for that much money two weeks turned to month and a half and who dont check axle before baron any key fits in it my kids four wheeler cranks it so anyone could us a key to get bad service

resp.text: I've never worked on this guys unit. Obviously this is a family member of Jamaya Langford. Jamaya paid my for the work we did $580. And declined the axle repair. I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Trinnie Faith (Tt)
text: terrible service and very unprofessional. save yourself the headache

resp.text: We have never spoke to you or serviced anything for you. Google once again allows reviews of none customers but expects companies to pay them for advertising. Pretty pathetic to say the least.

name: Cory Dunaway
text: I took my VT600 there for fork seals and said check all spark plugs and replace if needed while it is there. I get it back and noticed they only replaced 2. I called and asked why and was told my bike only has 2 spark plugs. (it has 4) I'm not sure what kind of mechanic can't identify 4 plugs and wires, but they've lost my future business. And the story by the owner about only having 2 in stock was never given to me until this Google review went up. Do better work and you won't get negative reviews. Not everyone wants to bring their bike back twice for something that was simple and should have been done the first time.

resp.text: Customer Brings in Vt 600 for fork seals and spark plugs. We only had 2 spark plugs instock. So we changed the primary plugs so he could enjoy this beautiful fall weather.  We had to order the other 2 plugs.  Customer is unsatified that he has to bring bike back to replace seconday plugs at no charge.  We only charged the customer for the 2 plugs we installed. We apologized for the inconvience.  Google and their reveiws leave me speechless to how easy an unreasonable customer can down grade your rating of your company.  Pretty pathetic GOOGLE!

name: Jamaya Langford
text: Spent 500$ on repairs and still didn’t fix it tore my lights up under the four wheeler up

resp.text: Lights and issues that where fixed where a liability both to the customer and my business.  The lights where rigged and a fire hazard. Mr. Langford ask us to fix a key switch initially that estimate was $240. We fixed the keys switch and then Mr Langford ask us to change the oil and to check to see if the rim was bent. Upon inspection we noticed that the wheel was fine but the bearing carrier was crack and bearings where bad. .  We replaced the cracked bearing carrier and bad bearings $240 parts and labor. Only to find that the axle was bent. When the axle was advised and the estimate of $250 parts and labor was given. Unfortanetly he declined and took the ATV else where.  I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Gene Lineberry
text: Did a good job on my busa 👍

name: Micah Cantrell
text: Bought an atv for my daughter today. They answered all my questions. They were very friendly and professional and not condescending at all (I an very ignorant about small engines (or any engine for that matter). They showed me everything I needed to know about simple maintenence and storage and even helped me load it in my truck. I've been to several places today, and they won my business with being knowledgeable, friendly, and they had the best price. I hope to use them in the future for my service needs. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you and Merry Christmas

name: James Shelton
text: Great place for all sxs needs.

resp.text: Thank you

resp.text: Thank you Larry!!

name: Joshua Wagnon
text: Very helpful guys with the best prices!

name: Montavvos Edwards
text: I had a very good experience

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Edwards

name: Joseph
text: These guys installed a clutch kit as well as a couple of other things. Very professional and the turn around time from when we dropped it off to when we picked it up was so fast. We highly recommend and we will bring our RZR back here.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Dustin Robbins
text: 20 years in business and it shows.

name: Jon Stebbins
text: Took a go cart there had a used stator put on for 100 dollars. Talked to the mechanic and guy at the front about putting a new carb on when I went to pick it up, He (mechanic) shows me a new carb tells me 50 for the carb and 50 for labor mind you the other guy was sitting there talking with us about it. So a week later I take it back to get the carb put on and when I go pick it up they charge me 204 dollars. The same guy tells me I must have misunderstood and the labor was 100. So why is it 204 I asked. Well he cleaned out the gas tank also he says. I had already cleaned the gas tank out and replaced all the gas lines and filter before I took it up there. This place is a ripoff. Over priced and will do bs work that you don’t ask for just so they can charge you more.

name: Joseph Morgan
text: Great guys to deal with. Great service and good deals.

name: Apoth3cary
text: I asked to replace front sprocket and they replaced rear. Took over a month for a chain and sprocket. Got the bike back with no gas. High price for barely adequate job.

resp.text: We have your worn out rear sprocket and chain here at our shop for you to come look at. And changing the sprocket does not include a free tank of fuel. Your front sprocket was approved by the technician as ok.  And your bike sat here at the shop 8 days after we called it completed. Safe travels Sir.

name: Gary Whitlock
text: Initially the work was good, quick and a fair price, just called and told them the fuel line they installed split, just told me the size it was, auto parts store said it was a vacuum line, not a fuel line, guess I'll have to figure it out for myself

resp.text:
We supplied the most reasonable solution. Displaying common sense. If you'd liked we could've asked you to spend the same 50 cents to drive to us and we would have given you  a fuel line after we ordered it We where out of stock that day. I assumed it would be just as easy for you to stop at a parts store and grab a fuel line. I do apologize that your 50 cent fuel line spilt we hope you where able to figure it out by your lonesome
.

name: jonathan croley
text: Dustin has always answered any questions I have had and gives honest advice . Best prices you’ll find and he will stand behind his products.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Jeremy Woodall
text: Best in the business! I've had them work on four wheelers, seadoo and my motorcycle. If you want it fixed and fixed right, bring them whatever you got!

resp.text: Thank you Jeremy.

name: Monte Carter
text:
Had a warranty claim and they got covered and finished in no time .
Very helpful and a great selection of parts.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review!

name: David Michael
text: Outrageous prices just for simple fixes. No organization. "Accidently" threw away parts. Say it will take one week but 2 and a half weeks later say they are still working on it. And this is all just to lace and true ONE wheel. Not even all the spokes. Just half of them

resp.text: Sorry Sir. looks like you dropped off right at Thanksgiving break

name: Ray Winburn
text: Very friendly very nice i haul polaris for a living driving semis and this is a very good place to come to if your looking

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Ray!

name: Jerry Brice
text: Thank you for being understand and helpful in answering my questions.

resp.text: Thank You

name: Jack Scott

name: Michael Mason
text:
I'm sure it's difficult for the viewer to reconcile the other one-star review with my five-star one. All I can do is report my experience; on my road trip out West, my R1200gs had a no-start condition somewhere near Birmingham. Kenny, the service manager, put me at the top of the repair list, and the tech fixed the problem plus corrected some glitches left by the previous owner plus corrected some of my less-than-adequate modifications to the wiring of the bike. My  BMW therefore was essentially more reliable than before the no-start fault (due to a failing battery by the way). Bike was fixed in one day.
Wandering through the KTM sales floor I had a very knowledgeable conversation with the sales guy there. I'd buy from there if my home was not so far away.

name: ernie catt
text:
We've purchased four new Yamahas from here since 2011 and couldn't be more pleased with the experiences. Sure, Scot'll talk your ear off. (grin) But, he's been places, knows folks all over the industry and believes in the products he sells. It's a small shop with genuine folks working there. No big store hard sell or worse - ignoring customers. No way!  This is a place where you can go and talk bikes/scooters/atvs and side-by-sides with confidence.
Yamaha has the #1 rating in customer satisfaction and after owning a slew of Hondas and Suzukis, I now know why. When two of my bikes had minor recall issues, TCY took care of the issues very quickly. I live almost an hour away. Having them work with me on appointment times, etc... was a real plus.

name: Melissa L
text:
Stopped by this place to look at the little 4 wheelers that they had sitting outside.   The price on the tag of the blue webbed little 4 wheeler was $695.00.   Went inside and inquired about other that they had inside and some had a sticker price for $995.00 and $695.00 same style 4 wheelers.   Ask lady behind the counter why the price difference and she couldn't give a straight answer then proceeded to say that the OWNER wrote a 6 instead of 9 and they were $995.00 not $695.00 as written on the tags of the others.  Then the gentleman that was behind the counter came out on the showroom floor and says "OH NO I CANT SELL THEM FOR THAT AND I CANT EVEN BUY THEM FOR THAT PRICE and proceeded to snatch the price tags off the ones that had a tag marked $695.00 on them in front of us.    Ask if he would sell for the price that was on it prior to him snatching the price tag off and he RUDELY said NO.  I am a small business owner myself, and would never have done this to a customer, especially pulling off price tags in front of a customer and telling them I can't honor the price tag that is on the item because of a mistake that was made by the owner of the busiess.  Honor the price that is on the tag and then correct the price issue after the customer has left the busines.
So buyer beware of this place of business.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel the need to try to hurt our business due to a small error. I'm happy you brought it to our attention and we have corrected the issue. We are a small business and sometimes mistakes are made. We can't afford to sell merchandise at a loss. We have a perfect reputation in our community and customer service will always be number 1. So thank you for stopping by, and we hope you find what you are looking for elsewhere.

name: Predator Hollywood
text:
Had been looking for a motor scooter for my 14 year old grandson; happened to see KMG on Facebook (gotta love that "free" advertising !!) and decided to check it out.  Upon arrival, saw displayed exactly the type of motor scooter we were looking for - and also saw this tall guy in a sun hat who greeted us.  Joe was EXTREMELY gracious, knowledgeable, friendly and laid back - he's just like a longtime friend that you haven't seen in awhile!  We decided on a white Wolf, full face helmet and alarm system.  The purchase process was very smooth and easy.  Joe answered all our questions and concerns and assured us that delivery could be expected in a few days.  Sure enough, 4 days later we returned to pick up the Wolf - it was all prepared and ready to go - just as Joe assured us it would be.  My grandson was so excited!  After break-in, we returned the Wolf to Joe for fluid changes and adjustments and again had a most pleasurable experience; the maintenance took only a few minutes; Joe even provided my grandson with several shaded sun shields.  It is with a great deal of pleasure and considerable pride that I highly recommend KMG Powersports and Joe Berrer and his staff to any and all who are in the market for a powersport.  You, too, will undoubtedly have the same pleasurable experience(s) that we had!
Joe Drop
Semmes, AL

resp.text: Thank you Joe. It has been a pleasure doing business with you.

text: Not one to leave reviews good or bad. But really disliked all my dealing with this place. Called two separate times to get my Rzr looked at (once was for a clutch recall), both times someone took my name and number and never got back to me. The other day went in there to get a price on a part. Was met with some attitude bordering on hostility. Dealership looks like it’s going downhill, very few units and low inventory. Real, shame since it’s the closest dealership to me.

name: Maria McSherry
text:
The sales experience was great! No complaints.

My garage kept, babied ATV with less than 22 hours on it started experiencing issues in May 2020. After researching the issue in case it was a simple fix, I requested a service appointment, and after several days I finally received a call stating they were behind. Fast forward to now almost 2.5 months later and every time I call to schedule the service, I’m told is that service department is behind, and they’ll get to me. That is too long for a service appointment. It makes me question how good the products really are...What good is the extended warranty if you can’t use it? My ATV is basically new and I can’t ride it. I will never purchase a Polaris product again.

resp.text: Sorry for the unusual experience.  We understand the frustrations of vehicle down-time, and work hard to shorten the time it takes to get your vehicle repaired when it does have issues.  We did have you scheduled for an appointment to bring your vehicle to us on May 18th and when you did not show we attempted to contact you to reschedule.  Since we did not hear from you we assumed the issues with your ATV were no longer a problem.  If your ATV still needs service, please contact us and we will be happy to get you back on the schedule for the next available appointment.

resp.text: Thanks Nickolas!  We appreciate your business!

name: Angie Porterfield
text:
If you are looking for an off road vehicle (atv, side by side) this is the first place to look. There was no pressure to buy today. Only the desire to listen so that could find the right machine for our needs and not the most expensive thing on the lot. Our salesman Spencer and the rest of the knowledgeable staff was able to answer every question that we had. The Staff also treated my wife with the respect that lacks in other dealer experiences . We left that day feeling like we have gotten a great deal and amazed at how friendly and respectful the staff is. We cannot say enough great things about the buying experience through Champion Powersports. The parts department has also been very knowledgeable and courteous while helping with parts and accessories for our ATV. The Polaris 570 utility edition that we purchased could not have been a better choice for our needs. This ATV has no trouble pulling the 950 pound trail mower we use on the farm or putting that smile on your face at the end of a hard days work . The 570 has more than enough power for the tough jobs or excitement out on the trail. The best way to describe the Polaris 570 utility edition and Champion Powersports is simple. The right tool for the job. Thank you to everyone at Champion for what you do.
Matthew Porterfield

text:
Robert and Brink are my go-to guys. Even though, Xtreme Offroad Ind. LLC (me) and Champion Powersports are competitors in our profession, every time I need to refill my supply shelf with Polaris specific maintenance items, or need to order specialty parts, I go see them. Usually you'll never hear of another powersport repair shop praising competition, but again these guys help me when I need it most.

I sometimes order parts that are on back-order or out-of-stock, but Jeff and the parts guys can usually get me fixed up somehow by working some magic! I ordered a crankshaft that was 3 months out on back-order and somehow they got it in 2 weeks. That is true customer service!

Again, Jeff, Robert, Brink, I appreciate you guys and whenever I need more Polaris supplies you'll be where I go first!

name: Michael Snowden
text: What a refreshing  experience I had at Powersports Service Center. I had a horrible experience down the street at a large dealer who kept my Honda Rancher for two months the first time to replace the carburetor and flush the fuel tank. After I finally picked it up I took off to Ohio on a week long hunting trip only to have it ruined by a carburetor that wasn’t installed properly. Matter of fact the 4 bolts that attach the carburetor were barely  finger tight causing fuel to leak into my air filter chamber. I came home and took it back for another 6 to 8 weeks and had to go sit in the waiting room to have someone actually work on my unit.   A week later after finally picking up my Rancher it wouldn’t crank. A friend told me about Powersports Service Center and  Chuck and the team were amazing. My unit was fixed in three days and the real problem was found and corrected immediately. My Rancher runs perfectly now cranking with the slightest touch of the starter. Powersports Service Center will be the only people who ever  work on my equipment from now on. Oh yeah, the price was very reasonable to top it off. Thank you Chuck!!!

name: Jacob Bare
text: Dropped off a bike I got for my Nephew to have 2 tires put on the bike and was quoted $30 per tire. Went to pick it up and they said it was $178. They also charged me for 2 new tubes I didn’t need or ask for. I brought a new one in a box I already had that was purchased there. When I asked for a breakdown the owner became instantly rude and just out right nasty. “Don’t buy one if you can’t afford the maintenance”. Then the other worker went and got the tech and said come here this guy is complaining and then said he’d roll it in the back and take it off. That’s were I put my foot down. The tech was the only person in there with a level head about him. I tried taking it to Dothan Power Sports 1st but the we’re too busy to get it in and out today. No customer service skills whatsoever. I literally thought I was going to end up in the parking lot with the 2nd guy and I wasn’t even dealing with him. I definitely will not be back.

resp.text: We’re sorry that your experience didn’t go as expected. The $30 per tire was a labor only quote that was made clear at the time the unit was quoted. Customer requested two new tires and when the tech disassembled the bike, noticed it was missing key safety strips on the rim, one tube was deteriorated, and replaced out of safety concern and the longevity of the repair. The additional items and Alabama mandatory tire sales fee were the only charges the customer wasn’t aware of. The customer was phoned to be informed, but didn’t  answer the phone during the servicing, so that we could make him aware of the extra needed items.  When the customer arrived to pick up the unit, and was presented the repair bill, he was adamant that he wasn’t going to pay for the extra items, so it was offered to remove the items and return his original equipment.  In the end the shop owner marked down the cost of the repair and the shop gave the customer a free tube to help ease the cost of the repair. It was noted to the customer when he was there, that we can’t estimate all unforeseen things needed in a repair until the actual job was being performed.

name: jim hutchins
text: I carried my Mule here to have a new battery installed , check voltage regulator, clean carb. They did these thing PLUS install air filters at $79 ( which were not requested)($39 on internet) charged me $130 for $40 battery. Voltage regulator $140 ( $39 ) on parts resources on the internet. Needle valve, just took off the float bowl didn't have to take off carb.  charges $20 for tiny needle valve. ($3  ) on internet. They said they cleaned out gas tank which they didn't, I've had to do it myself since I got it home. Won't ever take it back to them because they over charged me at $800 to do very little work and didn't do everything they said they did! Charge me 300% mark up on aftermarket parts. I was alarmed at the prices of parts and labor for such little work and then it not being done properly. Suggestion's, Make sure you get prices out front before they work on your bike!!!( The Mule work was in the name of Tim Hudson, check your work orders again! He Lives in Blakely Ga.)

resp.text:
Mr. Hutchins,
I reviewed our service repair tickets all the way back to June 2018, and we do not show ever working on a unit for you, listed as Jim Hutchins. Could you possibly be confusing our shop with Dothan Powersports(considering they sale and service Kawasaki product)?  If so, please kindly delete this unfavorable review of our facility, or inform us  to whom this unit was registered, for repair on the repair invoice, and date it entered the facility.
Thank you,
Jody Spann

name: Ted
text: Was quoted 6000 dollars on a  bike with an msrp rating of 4800. I recommend driving to Ozark to Beasleys Kawasaki. That is just outrageous. I was also quoted 5000 dollars on bikes that were between 3,500 - 4000 dollars most other places. I said I was a new rider, not an idiot.

resp.text: Mr. Conner. We never presumed you to be an idiot,  but you have to also understand business are different independent franchises.  Our prices at the time you visited this dealership reflected the total price out the door with all applicable state and local taxes and freight charges for the particular unit you were interested in. At this particular time we also has packaged prices for machines that included 5 years worth of warranty, jacket, helmet, and gloves. When you call different dealers in different areas they have the ability to quote you a machine at a lesser price and once your in the closing office they introduce the total price including the added fees. Something you overlook when ranting about our prices in this review, I'm sure.  The same goes for where you choose to purchase your auto, boat, or RV. Its called free enterprise and I hope you understand that ranting about it doesn't change what made this country great. Thank you!

text: Told me out would cost $300-400. Picked It up and it was $600. Now I'm selling my bike for parts. Go to Beasley's.

resp.text:
Greg,
Sorry this may have happened, unfortunately I don't have much in the way of information on your particular situation based on your unfavorable review.

As with an estimated guess,  looking at the crystal ball of problems, there is no way to accurately predict all situations, until the work is being performed. As well as, when a customer drops off a machine and doesn't complete reveal the entire back story. This may not be the case in this particular situation, but in many instances maintenance becomes a can of worms, and if the machine is to work properly (for which it was brought to the dealership) there are additional things to be performed. If those are not addressed, it can cause an unsafe machine and therefore cost yourself and the dealership more in the long run. We hope that you understand maintenance isn't an exact science.

name: Lezlie Warren
text: I am very disappointed with the service/lack of service provided by Hayne Motor Sports. My motorcycle needed minor adjustments along with diagnosis and tail/break light installation. When I dropped off my motorcycle they assured me it would only take a couple days to complete the work. They kept my motorcycle for two weeks and no follow up communication regarding my motorcycle what so ever. I called for an update after a few days and the receptionist told me they had no record of my motorcycle. In disbelief, I asked her to speak to the manager and locate it. After a while she told me that my motorcycle was there, but had not been worked on. The lack of work went on for two weeks. I called one last time and the manager informed me the motorcycle would be ready later that evening. I went to pick it up and they charged me $100 for an adjustment that was altered, NOT fixed. They did not even mount the tail/break light. It was ziptied and only the running light functioned. Not only did Hayne Motor Sport neglect my motorcycle, they charged me for ziptieing my tail/break light to the motorcycle and knowingly installed it with faults. This company does NOT respect the value of their customers property and neglectful to fixing the safety issues of our motor vehicles.

name: Keith McCurrach
text: Due to physical limitations I had been searching for a way to make my goldwing a trike. I searched different sites across the country and there were many that offered many different conversion kits. After reading reviews from people who converted their two wheel I had decided on one type. However I kept looking for goldwing that had already been converted and would take my in trade. I came across the site KD CYCLE in Altoona just north of Birmingham Alabama.  I looked at their inventory and what conversion kit they were using.  I had not heard of the type they used. But I liked the reviews of the cycle shop. Reviews were outstanding. So I researched the conversion kit. They used  the Roadsmith conversion kit. After researching the Roadsmith conversion I was sold on it. So I called KD and talked to Kevin.  We discussed options of conversion or trading. I told KEVIN I had a 2008 with 33k mikes, he thought I should consider a conversion because of the year and low mileage. Kevin also indicated they can do the conversion in one day and would also pick up and deliver.  I loved that option. I agreed to convert  and would get back to him on timing.  About 2 weeks later I was driving back from Dallas and decided to stop by the shop. There I met Michele. I talked to her about what I was looking for and wanted. During our discussion, I looked at their available inventory.  They had amazing looking trikes. I looked at each one, sat on many and talked to her about each. My intention was to see what they did and how the conversion kit looked. I was stunned at what I saw. I had my son with me and he kept guiding me to one he liked more than I did because of the color. Michele talked about the features it had and didn’t have.  One of my must haves was nav. This bike didn’t have nav.  It was a no go for me.  We looked at automatic drive trikes.  We kept talking about the inventory. Michele kept answering all type of questions, we kept at her about the inventory she had. Michele was amazing. So going from just wanting to see what KD was about, I decided to trade my bike for the one my son kept pulling me to. He and Michele said I needed to come to today and use my phone like most people did.  I had to agree.  We agreed on a trade in price and bike price.  I ended up with a 2016 trike with 2800 miles on it. So basically a new bike. WOW, didn’t see that coming. Kevin and Michele were amazing. The customer service they provided was second to none. You won’t find better customer service in this industry anywhere. There was no hard sell or pushing me to make a purchase.  I had already decided to convert. I would recommend anyone looking to convert or purchase one already converted KD is the place. You owe it yourself to at least call and talk to them and see what inventory they have.  I can’t thank them enough for their help and support   They are absolutely AMAZING.

name: Brad Penton
text: Whatever you do, DO NOT let them work on anything that you own.  I spent over $1,300.00 with them to repair my Honda four wheeler.  The say to only run marine gas in it.  They replaced the carburetor and put regular unleaded gas in it.  They charged me $3.50 for a gallon of gas.  More than marine gas would be.  They did not tell me this when I picked it up that they put regular gas in it.  It sat for four months with Covid-19 and work keeping me from using it.  Guess what?  The brand new carburetor now has to be serviced because of the gas they put in it.  They are more than happy to repair what THEY caused, for an additional $300.00.  These guys are crooks!  If I could give them negative stars, I would.

resp.text: There is no OEM warranty that covers gasoline solidification (which is caused by months of non-use). No machine can sit up for 4 months with any type of gas and not cause issues. It is your responsibility to either put stabilizer in fuel or periodically start up the machine.

Over the years, I’ve owned every type of the “Big Four” - Honda, Yamaha, Suzuki, Kawasaki  -  motorcycles, ATVs, and UTVs .  When it comes to quality and reliability you can’t beat Honda!  I won’t buy anything else!

I’m all about customer service … so much so that I drive 6 hours out of my way to buy from Hall’s Motorsports in Mobile, AL.    Andy Stacy, the sales manager, and Bob Smith, the finance lead, have always treated me with courtesy, honesty, respect, and the best price.  As long as Andy and Bob are there, I’ll always buy from Hall’s.  If you’re looking for the best, give Andy a call. You won’t be sorry!

Jack O’Rourke
Panama City

text: Though we are satisfied with our bike purchase we are very unsatisfied with our visit for the "first service" today. When we purchased the bike we were asked if we wanted to purchase a "service plan" we asked did this include future oil changes, etc. We were told "yes". So we purchased the "service plan" for $799. We took the bike in today for the first service only to be told that this was actually an "extended warranty!" Although the buyers order CLEARLY READS it as a SERVICE CONTRACT! We would have not EVER purchased a new vehicle of any sort without a service contract. The buyers contract is very misleading and lead us to believe that we were indeed purchasing the service contract that we inquired about. Very disappointed!

I drove from Dothan,Al to buy this machine and thought I would be treated better than this. I really dont mind the fee but the so called cleaning that was done was absolutely ridiculous.  Not clean at all. I will never do business with them again.

text: We live 2 hours in Florida and Thomas took amazing care of us. Got everything ready for us by the time we got there. Just a great experience with great people!

text: False advertised prices, and rude sales staff.

name: Ace Cannon
text: Easily one of the best Motorsports shops I've ever been in. All the staff are awesome and fun. Really enjoyed it.

name: RB Nelson
text:
I took a dirt bike to the Government St location in Mobile AL for repairs and was told they would straighten the handlebars for $100. After pickup I was charged the $100 and told they don’t straighten handlebars! I called and the service manager was unwilling to either refund the $100 or straighten the handlebars. He even refused to admit they charged me for straightening the handlebars and read the receipt which said nothing about my handlebars. I know what I was told would be done when I was quoted a price, they ripped me off. I would HIGHLY recommend not doing business with these crooks!
Update: In response to the owner’s reply... Your service manager was unprofessional and argumentative, repeatedly talking over me during our short conversation. I asked to be transferred to “the owner” because I thought you’d actually listen to a customer’s complaint, but I was told you were not there and I quote your service manager “I am the only one you’re going to deal with”. Sadly he was right because I still haven’t received a phone call from you to hear my side of the story.
I’ve heard stories about how you treat your customers. I’m just glad I learned my lesson on a dirt bike repair, not a purchase. Fortunately was only overcharged $100 but that’s enough to lose my business and spread the word for others to go elsewhere.
Don’t just take my word for it Mobile, I suggest you ask around before you do business with Hall's.

resp.text: We regret this customer feels this way about his service experience.  It is our company policy to not straighten handlebars if they are bent due to the structural damage that has been caused, for the safety of our customers.  Safety is our utmost priority and we were upfront that we cannot straighten/bend damaged handlebars.   We suggested to replace the handlebars, which was declined by the customer.  The only charges, stated in the customer's receipt, was for the replacement of front tire, oil change, and safety inspection.  We offered to repair the customer's damaged forks, triple clamps, and handlebars and unfortunately, those repairs were declined.

name: Phil Chavanne
text: Got my Goldwing serviced here: nicely done and fast. Was on a trip and pressed for time: they arranged that I could go on a lift immediately. That's good service. And while the bike was serviced I could discuss the tech specs of the new Honda models -- cool people they know their stuff. Recommended.

name: Richard “Buddha” Keele
text: Really helpful with explaining different models and their capabilities

name: steve kent

name: Dare Devil Diablo
text:
(Edited 4/30/19)

I bought a new $12,000 bike from Mobile Halls Honda in 2016.  This was my second brand new $10,000+ Honda.  I recently purchased a $10,000+ KTM elsewhere (Not from Halls) because I could not get this dealer to work with me.

First Red Flag, the bike had 14 miles on it at delivery.  I guess someone took it home for the night...  (They did disclose the mileage at the time of sale.)

Later, I had some issues and wanted the bike looked at under warranty.  I was told they would charge me to look at it if they could not submit a warranty claim to Honda.  This is lack of basic customer service.  If you want your customers to come back you take care of them.  Take care of your customer and they will take care of you.

Later still, I wanted to trade in my paid off bike that I purchased from them for a new one.  They told me if I wanted to trade in that they would "give me a good price" for my bike because I bought it from them and I'm buying another.  Great!!!, or so I thought...  They offered me about 80% of my motorcycles KBB Trade in Value.  80% of Trade In!!!  My bike is in like new condition, air conditioned garage kept!!

So long story short, I guess I am done with Mobile Honda.  I guess I wont rule out Halls in general...  Its kind of tough with them being the only game in town.

Trent Hall

I needed front brake pads for my Harley Davidson XR1200. The Harley shop didn't have any but said they could get some in 3 to 5 days.

Then I went to Halls Honda. The parts guy didn't laugh when I said I was looking for a Harley part. I explained the XR model Harley uses the same dual Nissin calipers as the Honda CBR900, CBR600, VTR1000 and several other models.

The parts guy took the time to research and found two sets of pads in stock for me to choose from.....  and at a great price. I was very impressed.

Based on this I would not hesitate to recommend Halls Honda for parts. This was a pleasant and surprising experience, I will be back. Thanks Halls.

name: Cathy Young
text: We drove 2.5 hours to purchase our beautiful, new Can Am Spyder RT Sea to Sky from this dealership and it was well worth it. From the very get go, Bree was amazing and straight forward.  We knew what we needed and wanted and she was able to give us it at a price that worked for us. Bree and the team here give: 1) true up front, out the door pricing, 2) a fair amount for trades, 3) no hassle financing and 4) great service all the way around. We appreciated the honesty she gave us from the get go knowing we had been working with another dealership. She never bad mouthed them or tried anything sneaky (can’t say the same for the Big #1) to win our business. She beat them in price and overall customer service. Casey, in finance, was able to get us a deal we could work with, warranties and services we needed and our financing approved quickly. When we arrived everything, to include our bike, was ready to go. When parts we were expecting were not immediately found, Tim, the General Manager, stepped in and started looking and found the part. From first phone call to driving away on our bike, it was a wonderful experience.

text: I can't understand the bad reviews.  I bought my first bike from them in 2003 (not my 1st motorcycle just the first from them probably my 25th) . Ordered a FJR 1300 . One of the first in the country. Drove from Atlanta, Ga to pick it up. The deal was $2000 less than the best in Atlanta. And several years later I moved to Santa Fe,  NM and decided I wanted a Star 1300. Shopped around and then called Gerald. His deal was so good I flew to Birmingham,  Ala and got a ride there. He had my Star serviced and gassed up ready to go. A few years later I did the same for a Kawi DLR 650. Each time my experience couldn't have been better. Everyone there was super nice and very knowledgeable. If I were in the market for a new bike today I wouldn't hesitate to call Gerald and hop a Southwest plane to Cullman. Ride back. Get it broken in on the way back to Santa Fe.  3 bikes from D & H. Perfect service. Great prices. Nice folks. I guess some folks want their boots shined for going in to a dealership. name: Ropa Vieja
text:
After spending a considerable amount of time shopping for a bike at various dealers I wanted to give a more concise review of my experience with this dealership.  My original review was a bit critical, due primarily to my lack of experience working with dealers when buying a new bike.   Let me elaborate:
Dealership:  Original review was that this was a typical Harley Dealership,  however after visiting a few others out of the area, I would say it is above average.  Welcoming staff with good selection of bikes and gear, an overall comfortable environment to shop.
Finance:  They definitely did not mess around with offering a solid interest rate out of the gate.  The finance person was great, explained all the numbers and answered all my questions.  The application process was easy and overall enjoyable.
Pricing:  Spot on pricing with MSRP.  Standard doc, destination fees, however there wasn’t an additional mark up on the price.
Sales:  This is where the deal fell apart. Another dealer offered to include the new riders course ($250) and deliver the bike for free ( a little over 50 miles ).  Being my local Harley dealer and a member of the same owners group,  I thought this might be standard among the three shops. It was not.   When I asked if they would do the same, the answer was “no”.  Asked if that was a deal breaker, I replied yes and that was the end of that until I posted my review here online.
A different sales person contacted me and tried to make the deal, unfortunately I was still annoyed and never really gave him a chance to try to work it out.
Overall, I have no reservations giving this dealer a 5 star review after shopping around, the majority of the process was smooth and enjoyable.  After all is said and done would I go back and try again, absolutely.

resp.text: Very sorry to hear this, Ropa.  Please give our GM, Mike DeSantis, a call at 205-560-1234.  He'll make sure you are taken care of.

name: Eric Roper
text:
SO, I had to come back and edit my review and give Chase and the Heart of Dixie a new 5 star review.

I posted a couple complaints I thought I had, about a recent purchase on a used 2016 Street bob. (That I totally love!)

well not 24 hours later. I get a text message from HOD, not only did they give me the information on something I was really agitated about. (I was mistaken by the way) they educated me and offered to assist me with any more info on my bike that they could.
NOW, that's good service. this guy went outta his way to make sure I was informed, and felt good about the purchase of my used bike!
I am a very skeptical person when it comes to using dealers for anything. but these guys seem to really get it, and try to do right for the customers like me that are spending hard money on even used bikes, not just the new ones!
GET THE WARRANTY! how can you go wrong with a lifetime drive warranty? Ill trust them, cause they seem to care.
Heart of Dixie will be my go to shop! and Ill continue to review them 5 star for all my bob's needs!

THANKS SO MUCH!

resp.text: Thank you very much for the awesome review, Eric!  Your business is greatly appreciated!  We're always happy to help any way that we can so give us a call or come by any time.  Let's ride!

name: Lynn Johnson
text: On a road trip two weeks ago I broke a clutch cable in afternoon traffic on 280 in Birmingham. Hot as blazes,  shops closing up, I was far from home, in real trouble, with somewhere to be. Called Heart of Dixie. They had the obsolete cable in stock, but we're getting ready to close for the day. Service Manager Zack Apple went above and beyond to get me back on the road. Not only did he bring the cable to me at the point of breakdown, but he also brought a truck and trailer, and took myself and my bike to my destination so I could make the repairs I needed to continue on my way. Kudos to HOD HD for going the extra mile to see that my trip went ahead without delay.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review and kind words, Lynn!  It was no problem at all and we were happy to help.

name: Charles Franklin
text: I went in to buy myself, my wife, and daughter all new shirts 2 different men asked me how I was doing, NOONE asked "may I help you" I get up to the cash register to pay $102 for my shirts, I told the lady I was from Poplar Bluff MO and just drove 6 1/2 hours to get here, didn't interest her, told her I was just on a poker run in Illinois last Saturday with 200 bikes, didn't interest her, what did interest her was when I asked could I pay for it with rolled up coins, she was all happy to accept this till my daughter brought the money in, she then proceeded to tell me it would take about another 30-45 minutes cause she has to open every roll of coins, and count them, I asked her why do this just pick out 1-2 of them open them and count those, she informed me that if it was short just 1 coin, it would come out of her pocket, so I threw $3 on top of the change and said "here this should cover the missed coin so instead of paying $101 and some change for 3 shirts, I ended up paying $102 in rolled change plus 3- $1 bills so $105 for 3 shirts and she didn't even give me my change. I'm going everywhere I know (Facebook,media, newspapers,etc.) Telling my story "DO NOT SHOP HEART OF DIXIE HARLEY DAVIDSON IN PELHAM ALABAMA!!!!! )

name: Bob Kuehner
text:
UPDATE on 10/20/2015... The GM reached out to me quickly and decisively and solved my most recent problem.  I was really impressed with what he said about his commitment to making the quality of service at Heart of Dixie as great as the quality of shopping and sales.

ORIGINAL POST on 10/15/2015... Loved the "bike purchase" part--5 stars.  Bought a brand new Vrod Muscle in 2011 and a new Road Glide Ultra in 2012.  Unfortunately, like so many other businesses out there, once you buy they forget all about you.  I'm speaking specifically about service--1 star.  The quality of service is fine--4 star, but the speed of service is what kills the rating for me--1 star.  Waiting two weeks on a regular basis to get your bike back is crazy.  That's been my experience on multiple occasions.  Counting today, five times, I've discovered problems as I'm about to go out of town on a ride.  They've been completely unwilling to work me in and help out so that I could make my trips.  Today was a little different.  I tried to get through to service and left messages beginning a 4 pm and now they've closed and still no call back.  I've had much better luck on service with Rider's Harley Davidson in Trussville.  Interesting to me that both stores are owned by the same man.  I've heard it said that the easiest customer to get is the one you already have.  In this particular case, I'll have to decide if the "joy" of owning a Harley is worth the aggravation of getting it taken care of!

resp.text: Hi Bob, We're very happy that we were able to get this fixed for you.  We greatly appreciate your business and strive to make your Harley-Davidson experience here at Heart of Dixie top notch.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to us in the future as we're always here to help.  Thanks again and we look forward to working with you again soon!

name: larry Hatchett
text: Well once again I take my bike in for issue I couldn't find out what it was asked a friend he said could be rear bearings or neck bearings unload go in talk with guy at counter( problem, bike has a roar and vibration at 20 to 40 mph when leaning toward the left can tell sound is coming from rear has a wobble at 70 + mph to the left ) so we walk outside I explained problems and my concern about bearings was told I needed to buy a rear tire [not covered in warranty] [bike has 4500 miles] because it was cupped on left side because I was making to many lefthand turns I asked if they could be a problem with bike causing the cupping told no is was how I was riding  so I asked if I purchased rear tire and the vibration is still in bike do I have to still pay for rear tire when it was not the problem was told yes I do was also told the neck bearings wasn't covered in warranty understand this all come from just walking outside NO TEST RIDE nothing but conversation about how I need to buy stuff before they even check the bike out seams like all this service department is about is selling parts to find out problems instead of having good techs to find problems for customers just because we buy 20,30,40 thousand dollar bikes don't mean we want to spend hundreds more on hunches of what might be a problem.

resp.text: Hey Larry, I understand your frustation and I'm very sorry to hear this.  I will have this reviewed by our GM and will make sure this is taken care of for you.  Please let us know the best way to get in touch with you so we can get this fixed.

name: Ryan Church
text:
Stephanie Gallagher is a fantastic Salesperson who stayed late to answer all our questions before we made our purchase. Even after we made a purchase she has continued to check with my wife via phone calls and texts to make sure we are still happy and the family is enjoying the Viking VI. I would highly recommend her as a sales person and as a generally very nice individual who has gone above and beyond to build and keep a relationship. I would recommend her and her team to get you into a quality ATV and to answer your questions thoroughly before you make a purchase.
Oh, and the builder at Speedzone thought that he might have missed tightening a bolt, so Stephanie called and asked if he could immediately come out to our house and check it. He came out, checked the bolt and got it all taken care of. Very professional and responsive. Very courteous and showed that they care about their customers. Will definitely do business with them again.

name: Heather Holcomb
text: We had a wonderful experience. Our sales guy was Jimmy. We were treated with respect and he made us feel welcome. We bought a 4-wheeler and we love it. Plus the whole staff was great too.

resp.text: Thank you so much. Enjoy your new atv.

name: M T
text: Absolutely great service and friendly help! Stephanie Swafford was excellent help when making my purchase.  I pretty much bombarded her with questions via txt on a particular ATV to help me confirm all the features before I made the hour drive. Would totally give SpeedZone my business again.

name: Zane Cardwell
text: The level of customer service at this Speed Zone location is the by far the pinnacle of what customer service should be. The sales team was incredible especially my salesperson Jayla. Living two hours away was rather daunting when taking into consideration not only the logistics of getting the 2020 YZF-R6 I searched so hard for, but also just how overwhelming it felt being my first brand new bike to purchase from a dealership, however Jayla was there the entire time and through every step of the way. At no point did I ever feel lost through the process. If premier quality of customer service is important to you then look no further Speed Zone of Oxford is the place you want to be and Jayla is the sales person you want to have.

name: Hayden Lee
text:
Back in November(2020) I bought a bike from a private party. I brought it here to have some preventive maintenance done plus a couple of extra things. Tyrone listened to what I was wanting done and never tried to over sell me. Any questions I had he answered and if he didn't know he found someone who did.

The tech, Marcelo, does great work and is quick. In less than a week he had my bike running like a brand new one. I've put a few hundred miles on it since I got it back from their service department and I will confidently use them again.

resp.text: Thank you so very much. We appreciate you.

name: Roarke Pendleton
text: Worked with Chris on getting a Yamaha Tenere 700. Put a deposit down in March and the bike came in today. Fantastic experience from start to end. Great communication made waiting on the bike easier! I'd definitely buy from them again.

resp.text: Thank you so much

name: Tom McDonald
text: I had a positive purchase experience.  Chris and I communicated frequently via text which made getting updates easy.  The building was clean, I observed positive staff/buyer interactions.   My experience with the finance representative was also positive.   Nothing was pushed on me to additionally purchase and the casual conversation was enjoyable.

name: More Than More
text: Worked with Stephanie Gallagher here to purchase a few dirtbikes for my kids, she was absolutely fantastic.  She was able to give me all the information I needed over the phone which was important due to my schedule, and we were able to handle most of the transaction before I traveled to the store to pick up the bikes.  While there she was extremely helpful with answering questions and helping me with establishing the financing through Honda, and Jeremiah over in parts was awesome with the kids.  He was able to get all 3 set up with helmets/goggles/ boots while I was working on the paperwork, and they all loved their new gear.  So overall, great shop and great folks, highly recommend.

name: Thomas Van Dyke
text: Just got back from a visit at this dealership that might’ve been my best ever.. I had an iffy visit here when I purchased my bike about two years ago, but this visit for an oil change and maintenance was very pleasant.. Tyrone and Troy in the service department were great and fit me in for service and I was greeted very politely by Stephanie on the sales floor while I was walking around killing time.. I’d recommend people visiting this business just based on these three employees alone. I’ll return again in the future.

text: They where not friendly at all to start with we had to as excuse me 3 times to 2 ppl. But the guy with a beard in the back(we bought a helmet) was very nice and came out and helped me

text: Stephanie swafford hooked me up with an awesome 2020 gsxr 600 for an awesome price! Couldn't be happier with how fast she got a deal worked out saved me thousands!! And kept me in the budget I asked for! Definitely recommend anyone to ask for her if you are wanting anything.

text: If you are looking for a new dirt bike I would definitely recommend going here and speaking to Jayla! I drove from Atlanta in search for a new bike for my husband and she made the process nice and easy! She was also so friendly and made me feel so comfortable. Will come back for sure!!

text: This place is great! Stephanie Swafford helped me with my purchase and answered any questions I had! I definitely recommend Stephanie for anyone who is looking for their next toy!

name: Blake Parrish
text:
Tried buying a 2021 Honda Pioneer From Them
Sales guy tried his best to make it work but they have a horrible management issues msrp on the machine is 12,399 got an out the door price of over 18,000 and come to find out they wanted to add a 5 year factory warranty and service plan told them I wasn’t interested in any extra add ons as such and was told they would remove them then came back with a price of over 16,000 now trying to include a 7 year warranty instead of a 5 year told them I DID NOT WANT the extended warranty and was told that they have people lined up to buy the machines with the extended warranty and they wouldn’t sell it to me without including it! This is not a dealership this is a STEALERSHIP!!!!
BEWARE ANYONE LOOKING TO PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM THEM AFTER THIS I WOULDNT BUY A 10 DOLLAR BICYCLE FROM THEM. THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE

resp.text:
Blake,
I know you talked with one of our operations managers today. Was anything resolved? I see via the correspondence between you and the sales person there seems to be some miscommunication with what was said and what you posted here.

name: Sean Ostrander
text: Huge shoutout to Jayla at Speedzone in Oxford. Amazing customer service before, during, and after the sale. After the sale, I had something come up (it was my mistake) and Jayla and Tyrone both helped me figure it out. I'll be buying another toy from her in the future for sure!

name: Robert Powell
text: Jayla was most helpful. She stayed late and approved parts install same day! Entire process was a breeze. If you need fast and courteous service, Jayla is your rep! They’ll ring the bell and make you feel so welcome. If I could rate 10-stars, I would!

name: Bobby Stone
text: Came here looking for a drz 400s and luckily they had one in stock, my salesman, Chris, was awesome, helpful and informative. Didnt expect to be leaving with a bike so soon. Just wish they had more helmets in stock, the one i wanted wasnt available in my size but all in all im happy.

name: Janna Strickland
text: Stephanie Gallagher just walked us through purchasing two WaveRunners. She was very knowledgeable and was able to guide us to selecting what we needed for our family. When we had questions about add-ons/warranties, she immediately brought us the sales manager to make sure we fully understood what we were purchasing. When we shared our hesitation with purchasing two. She made us feel very comfortable with just buying one. She was patient with us while we went home and called/text her with additional questions to help us consider all options. When we made the decision to buy two, she helped us find what we wanted for our son even though that meant searching at other stores. We had some very specific requests, based on the needs of our family that Stephanie and the Sales Manager were able to make happen for us, even though our requests were different than any customers before. Purchasing from SpeedZone was a great experience. Ask for Stephanie G.

text: You will definitely have fun the moment you walk into this place! From the atmosphere to the staff it is all great. I'd recommend talking with Stephanie Swafford, she knows her stuff and made the transaction super easy and not an inconvenience. Will definitely do business here again.

name: Michael Duke
text: Hats off to the team at Speed Zone in Oxford!! Stephanie Swafford was excellent at answering all of my questions and getting me out the door with what I wanted!! Thank you Stephanie!!  I would also like to thank Jeremiah who made quick work out of an upgraded tire package that I requested!! Thank you sir. And lastly I would like to thank Eric the finance manager as he was extremely patient getting me taken care of. Thank you Eric. Another huge shout to Stephanie and Eric as they closed this deal way after closing hours due to some banking issues I was having with daily spending limits!! You guys met then exceeded my expectations!! Thank you!

name: Mike Fisher
text: This dealer is taking advantage of customers during a time when production has been slow due to the pandemic. They misrepresented several things to us. We were told they have to pay Honda MSRP so their only way to make any money was to charge us a $1600 freight and bolt charge. That is simply not true. They also tried to sell us a maintenance plan saying the first maintenance required on the machine we were considering would cost $500. We discovered this maintenance was simply changing the oil and spark plugs which can easily be done by me for a material cost of $65. We had a UTV we took to get a possible trade in value on and after having their service department look at it came out with a long list of work it needed and offered us a RIDICULOUSLY low offer of $1850. We took that machine to a mechanic later and it required a tune up that cost me $150 and I sold it for $6000. Not only are they gouging people on pricing they are being dishonest while doing it.  Needless to say we did not buy anything here. Won’t go back and won’t recommend. Bought the machine they quoted us for $3000 less at a dealer in Mississippi. Well worth the drive to get it. Shop around. Call them. Honda of Laurel. Great honest folks.

name: Eric Larson
text:
I would be careful relying on the reviews by folks with 1 or 2 total reviews and no profile ect. More than likely fake accounts made to influence the rating on Google.  Look though the reviews of those with real accounts.

We had mixed experiences. It seems it depends on the mood of the sales folks if they want to be fair or try to score on a huge markup on a sale.

You will find “internet” pricing on many of their products and that price seems fair compared to other shops. The problem is when they give you the “out the door” price you will see they jack up the “fees” to more than make up for that good price.

They matched another dealer on our first purchase.    When I wanted to buy a second machine they quoted almost $7,000 out the door on a $4,697 internet priced motorcycle with original msrp $5,299.   $1,700  in “fees” plus taxes.

Just be aware of the hard sale tactics and watch the dealer fees.  They also want you to buy the massive markup warrantee and finance at 15-25%.  They actually don’t seem to want cash sales.

Needless to say I drove over to Atlanta and I’ve found several dealerships much easier to deal with. We bought the same bike for way under $6,000 out the door. The crazy part is I actually ended up buying 2 bikes at the dealer in Atlanta!   My son got a new R3 and Wife got a Ninja 400.

name: Foster Stevens
text: Very nice people but puzzled when they told me a brand new battery I just put in my kids gocart wasn't any good. Bought a service plan that wasn't worth the money. But had to get it fixed so I got to pay!

name: Tony DeBusk
text: Beware of bait and switch tactics! Speedzone has an Xr650l listed on Cycletrader for $6089. When I called to confirm this price I was told that that price was listed in error. A few hours later the price was increased to the standard $6999 price everyone is asking for that bike. One month later I checked back and the price is again listed for $6089! This is clearly bait and switch tactics!

Edit- Please read all paperwork carefully before you sign! I was tired & ready to go home when they got the paperwork ready. There are charges added that I have no idea what they are! What is a “bolt on” fee??? Why did I get charged their shipping cost? I ended up financing apx $5000 more than the listed price. I know it’s my fault for not paying attention but I promise, I felt really stupid when I finally got my paperwork out & went over it...

Not a good experience at all!

Then when I made them give me the price they were $2700 over their listed price on the website.  I told them I already had two quotes over 2k less than them for the same unit.  They acted like I was lying to them when I told them that.  We agreed to part ways at that point.  They tried to prey on me to make some money.  Don't go here unless you have quotes from other places and have done your homework.  Don't let them bait you with their low internet prices and then stack the add on charges on you in the end. text: My name is Sherri Spruill from Mt. Pleasant, Tx.  We have been a Honda-Kawasaki dealer here for 55 years!   We recently sold 2 Mules that are being used at the Army Depot in Anniston. Tyron, who has nothing to gain, offered to help me get the Mule to his sister store to get the repairs done (remember, we are 10 hrs, one way to get there).  As it turns out, we decided to switch the unit for the depot and bring the problem unit back to Tx.  THE POINT IS  TYRON IN SERVICE IS WONDERFUL< AWESOME<AND OFFERED TO HELP ME IF NEEDED!!  Do not hesitate to use Tyron.  God Bless.  :-)

text:
Hands down worst customer service in my life. The prices are outrageous and the staff do not care about the customer. I asked for a help with a flat tire (kids 50cc bike) and they quoted me at $100.00 for repairing it. I told the guy it could just need air and might not need anything else, but he didn’t seem to want to air it up for me real quick to check. I then ask for a price on checking out an ATV (kids 50cc) and making sure the governor is working properly. He stated that would be $100.00 just to look at it. I told him I would put both bikes in for a full tune up service if the price was good. He stated he could do $150.00 tune up for the ATV but still would charge me an addition $100.00 to look at the governor issue. I told him that all he had to do is turn the bike on and hit the gas (in order to see if it has a governor issue). He said that is not included in the tune up (apparently they don’t start and run bikes they do tune ups on...🤷🏽‍♂️) so I would pay a total of $250.00 for just the ATV.

I have been riding bikes and visiting motorcycle shops for 25 years. Worst experience ever.

name: Christina Malone
text:
DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE! THEY WILL SAY ANYTHING TYou O MAKE A SALE! THEY WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AN INEXPERIENCED CONSUMER!

My 20 year old son purchased a Rancher with accessories including snorkel kit with Bama Power Sports. The salesman asked the service manager if installing the snorkel kit would void the warranty, the service manager said he didn't know but not to worry about it. They would fix it if it messed up. So, it was not disclosed to him that by using the accessories he purchased it could potentially void his warranty. He was however told by the salesman, in front of two witnesses, that Bama Power Sports would warranty it for 1 year "It doesn't matter if you set it on fire or run it into a lake, we will cover it".  THEY SAID WHATEVER THEY THOUGHT HE WANTED TO HEAR TO MAKE THE PURCHASE.

The first time my son took his Rancher out he used the snorkel kit. It got water in it. He looked under the 4-wheeler and there was a hose unattached. Had to be a poor install since it was the first time my son took it out. Honda Warranty will not cover it, snorkel kit, makes sense. But now Bama Power Sports is denying the salesman ever said anything about a 1 year warrant to these kids. Now I know these kids do not know anything warranties so they did not make this statement up. Bama Power Sports allowed my son to leave there thinking he was completely covered and is now refusing to make things right. $1,800 repair.

We tried to negotiate some sort of deal with them to take partial responsibility but they refused to speak to our attorney or have their attorney speak to ours. We decided we didn't trust these people enough to even work on it. When we went to pick it up they brought it out in pieces on pallets. I just hope all the parts are there. We now have to take it to someone else to fix it. Expensive way for my son to learn some places are dishonest and get everything in writing.

The salesman said they don't take trade in's despite the fact that there were used/traded in bikes all over the place. I have a like/hate attitude towards this place if that makes any sense.

text: Leslie is great, she always makes sure my pioneer gets serviced and back to me as soon as possible.

name: Kelly Mayne
text: Wonderful atmosphere and competitive pricing. Ask for Eric; he’s knowledgeable and friendly!

text: This is a go too store every guy should check out. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable

text: Internet sales manager Chris gave us a great experience and a reason to buy At SpeedZone of Oxford. If you are in the market for something, go and see the guys at SpeedZone!

text: Go and see  internet manager Chris at speedzoneoxford motorsports in oxford Alabama! I got 300 dollars referral money today! They are a great group of guys and gals!!

name: Terrence Melton
text: Stephanie provided me with good care, come see her!!!

name: William Wade
text: Mark in service was very rude and hateful to me. Will not ever go back to Speedzone again.

name: brandon cook
text: (EVERY ONE MUST READ )DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH SPEEDZONE OF OXFORD.  They advertised a sxs for one price but wrote it up for more than they advertised.not talking about the add on like extended warranty or prep fees.im talking the price on the tag for the unit. Save your self some time and money go to Motorcycle sports or Talladega cycle. Speedzone is already over priced. They sold my wife a used rzr for 2500 more than what it would cost new and it was bone stock.(extra b.s) so after taking our Polaris to have serviced thru there speed pass.this is ruffy 1 year later cause hey I paid for why not use it. Well let's start off by saying this is the 3rd time the ploaris has been in for service.so dropped it off on a Tuesday and they tell me it will be ready on the next day. So the next day rolls around and I do not get a call to come pick it up. So the next day Thursday I call them and ask if it's ready to be picked up. They informed me yes it is ready. So let's load the trailer and go to pick it up.once getting there they hand me paper work and he goes to find my sxs. He is walking around everywhere in the shop to find this sxs. So I look at the paperwork and it is paperwork for a Honda i used to own not the Polaris so I tell him it's the ploaris not the Honda due to the Honda being in Texas now. They then go on to tell me that they just completeld the work on my Honda.so that's when I decided to let him know that it's in Texas. But yet they did the service and paperwork.once we found our ploaris we were told it would be ready the next day. So moving on to next day we get there to pick up the machine thsy has 150 hrs on it and they only do a 25 hr service on the machine. They cant tell me how many services it has had even tho they did it. So there goes our warranty  and extended warranty. Man this place is the biggest joke ever. For anyone to buy from them and give a good review. They must be standing by your side telling you what to write before you leave there store.

name: Belinda Holmes
text: Great mix of ATVs and UTVs on the showroom! Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable !

name: Lei Liu
text:
My husband went to this dealer today. He wanted to buy a specific type of motorcycle and asked the staff to see if they have it in the inventory. The staff who spoke to him disappeared for 20 minutes, and showed up to help another customer without saying a word to us.
We will not return to the store again.

text: Leslie was fantastic helped me out getting my bike fix quick and found me the best price.

text: Mike was very courteous and helpful. He did not pressure me into buying and he listened to my needs and what i was looking for. i would recommend Speedzone Motorsports to anyone who is looking for a great deal and great customer service. Come see Mike he is a really good guy.

text: Excellent customer service, very knowledgeable and courteous staff. Bought a side by side and four wheeler for the kids. They gave me a really good deal on the package.

name: Michael Murphy
text: Stephanie G great service

name: Brandon “Peanut” Morrow
text: Recently bought a Hammerhead (mudhead) and a Honda Pioneer 1000, Just and the mudhead serviced and Leslie Pitts took care of everything for me, very easy process with my speed pass.

name: M F
text: The service advisor Leslie Pitts does a great job putting customers first and values their time. Thank you for your services.

resp.text: Thank you so much! She is the best!

name: TopTenGacha
text: Awesome experience!  Mike and Cain were a big help. They even helped me pick out my safety gear. Great guys!

name: Frank Yeager
text: FYI. Speed zone motor sports does not do service work on anything over 10 years old. I called about having the electronic shift looked at on my rancher 350. The lady said we are backed up so it will be a couple weeks before I can get to it. I told her that would be fine I wasn’t in a hurry that I just needed it before hunting season. She said bring it down. So I spent 20-30 minutes hooking up the trailer and loading the 4-wheeler and 45 minutes driving down there. Just to find out they will not work on my 2005 rancher. Let me be clear, I’m not upset that they wouldn’t service my atv. I’m upset that about 3 hours of my Saturday had been wasted and could’ve been avoided by simply telling me their policy over the phone. And the fact that the lady acted as though I had wasted her time. When in actually I feel as though my time was wasted. I’ve bought several parts and dealt with Bama Power sports service dept before this interaction with no problems whatsoever. Not to mention Bama Power Sports seemed to be thankful for my business. I’ve never left feeling as though I wasted their time. I was concerned when I saw management was changing but with all the good reviews I figured it would be the same experience as before. This was definitely a let down and my business will go elsewhere

name: Ken Barry
text: Visited the service department. They have some very well trained  technicians that know their job and take good care of your bike.

name: matt Gibby
text: Bought New can am 2019 Maverick from Them and Nothing but issues . First time took it in keep it for 2 months had to change the starter and change the oil 3 Ridiculous . Took it out to ride with my son and BROKE again says missed fired on code they say and the belt was shredded unit has less than 40hrs on it service sucks bought extended warranty and they denied all warranty and trying to get them to call you back horrible would not recommend this place to anyone

name: Matthew Mims
text: Mark in the parts department was very helpful when I called to find parts for my Pioneer. Highly recommend this business!

name: Logan Waldrep
text: Thanks to Jennifer for helping me purchase a 2018 Yamaha Viking EPS. Also thank you to Melissa in the financial department for working with me so I was able to purchase this unit.

name: Blaine Hurt
text: I went in a little while back just looking for a mask for cold weather riding.  I walked in and didn't see anyone nor was I approached.  That's not a big deal, but after not finding what I was looking for I started looking for an employee.  I heard people laughing in the back and found all the employees laughing and carrying on.  I stepped in and asked about the mask, after they all went silent as if I had interrupted their important meeting, one guy turned and pointed me in a direction instead of showing me where they were.  I just walked out the door.  I realize it was a small item, but that was incredibly poor customer service.  I did not feel welcome.

name: Kane Pitts
text: Awesome experience with Speedzone Motorsports! Go see Leslie in Service.

name: TJ
text: Stopped in at Sppedzone and asked about a sxs that has a MSRP of about $17,000.00 and the salesman said that's about $20,000.00 out the door. But, on Speedzones website it was $15,540.00 and I brought that to his attention and then he said it will be about $18,000.00  out the door. I said why didn't you say that when I asked and he said you have to tell us the internet price to get it for that. I said that is ridiculous. I will be going somewhere else. He called me a little while later and said I could get it for $15,640.00 out the door. I ended up going to Auburn to buy it because I feel Speedzone is a RIP off. The place in Auburn was straight forward when I called and asked the price out the door.  Speedzone  also quoted me a windshield for $512.00, that on Hondas website has a MSRP of $479.00. So be aware and know how much stuff is before you go here.

name: Andrew Zinn
text: I want to thank Jennifer and all the staff at SpeedZi\one once again.  I was very pleased with my Honda PCX 150, but felt like it was time to upgrade to a larger, more powerful ride.  I liked the Honda DCT series of bikes.  I was keen  on the idea of having manual AND automatic transmissions on the same bike.  I felt this would be a logical transition from moped to a cruiser style bike.  Jennifer and the helpful financing department were able to help me trade in my moped and put me on a brand new Honda CTX 700.  I got on the bike and got used to it.  I rode and rode and had to make myself go home because I was having such a hell of a time riding.  If you're looking to make a change in what you're riding, or want to start riding period, I strongly recommend you visit Jennifer in sales and the other friendly and helpful staff at SpeedZone of Oxford.

text: I just bought a 2018 Suzuki rm 85 from speed zone! The staff is awesome! Mike Lovvorn has been my salesman from the get go! This dude is awesome. He sold me my 2017 Suzuki Gsxr less then a year ago! These guys are really easy to work with, and everyone in the staff came to me and shook my hand after my purchase. I have nothing but good things about the company! This company is super helpful and knowledgable about motorcycles. So thanks again Mike Lovvorn! Thanks speed zone! I will return for more services and units in the future!!!!!

text: This place is ridiculous!! Been calling for 3 days no and no answer. I drove 30 minutes to come here and they are not open. Its Friday 3:00 and doors are closed! Cant figure out their deal

resp.text: Hello Renee we apologize the old owners closed the store after Christmas through New Years. They sold their business to us and we took over ownership on January 17th. Please let us know if we can help you. Please give us a call or e-mail. Thank you

text: Speedzone motorsports is a great place to do business. They were very nice to me, I even got a $300 referral from salesman Chrisl. Go see speedzone motorsports, they are a lot of fun!

name: Jon Pence
text: My wife and I went there after a bad experience with a Polaris Dealer in Sylacauga Al. Everyone was extremely nice and very helpful. I ended up getting a new ATV b/c their customer service was so good. I had been up there a week prior with an issue trying to find a replacement axle nut of unknown size for my other atv. The service manager stayed out in the parking lot with me measuring and going looking in the service book for 30 minutes for a $8.00 part. So far have had great experiences with sales and service. I would recommend anyone to go there and I will definitely be a return customer. Great Job guys! I am looking forward to doing business with you in the future.

name: Robert Johnson
text: I recently went in for service to my 2002 Sv650s. It was back firing,i was told it was running to lean and a jet kit needed to be installed since i had a yoshi exhaust. Long story short, they had my bike for exactly a month charged me almost 500 dollars for everything and on the ride home i had the same problem. Still popping and hiccups. Throttle response was great an more power but that's not why i brought it there. So i went home looked at the carbs and the funnel of the carb was cracked. Its suppose to be new parts. Took it back the next morning told him everything an showed him the crack his response "how did you see that". My opinion, if you have a real issue with your bike take it somewhere else, but if you need tires or something small, by all means go ahead. Once they fix this ill never go back for anything other than riding gear or the snack machine. I wish i would have taken the 2.6 review on Google more serious.
